Class w3c.thotlib.Element 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----w3c.thotlib.Element
public class Element
extends Object
Java Classe associated to a Element.

The Java class is just a wrapper around the actual Element data structure handled in the native code.

element

Element()
Dumb initialization, don't use it unless you know the internals.
Element(Document, ElementType)
Create a new Element in the native Thot library and wrap it in a new Java Element object.
Element(Document, int)
Create a new Element in the native Thot library and wrap it in a new Java Element object.
Element(int, int)
Create a new Element in the native Thot library and wrap it in a new Java Element object.
Element(long)
Initialize a new Element object for an existing Element existing in the native code data space.

Creates a new element of a given type and inserts it in the tree as a descendant of a given element.

element 
 public long element

Element 
 public Element()
Dumb initialization, don't use it unless you know the internals.

Element 
 public Element(long value)
Initialize a new Element object for an existing Element existing in the native code data space.

Parameters:
value - the actual reference to the native element
Element 
 public Element(int docNo,
                int type)
Create a new Element in the native Thot library and wrap it in a new Java Element object.

Parameters:
docNo - the number of the document which will contain this element.
type - the type number of the element (w.r.t. the document SSchema)
Element 
 public Element(Document doc,
                int type)
Create a new Element in the native Thot library and wrap it in a new Java Element object.

Parameters:
doc - the document which will contain this element
type - the type number of the element (w.r.t. the document SSchema)
Element 
 public Element(Document doc,
                ElementType elType)
Create a new Element in the native Thot library and wrap it in a new Java Element object.

Parameters:
doc - the document which will contain this element
elType - the element type of the element

NewTree 
 public static Element NewTree(Document doc,
                               ElementType elType,
                               String label)
Create a new Element in the native Thot library and wrap it in a new Java Element object. Also creates all its descendants, according to the structure schema.

Parameters:
doc - the document which will contain this element
elType - the element type of the element
label - a label string for this tree.
Returns:
the root Element for the new tree or null in case of failure
NewTree 
 public static Element NewTree(Document doc,
                               int type,
                               String label)
Create a new Element in the native Thot library and wrap it in a new Java Element object. Also creates all its descendants, according to the structure schema.

Parameters:
doc - the document which will contain this element
type - the type number of the element (w.r.t. the document SSchema)
label - a label string for this tree.
Returns:
the root Element for the new tree or null in case of failure
NewTree 
 public static Element NewTree(Document doc,
                               ElementType elType)
Create a new Element in the native Thot library and wrap it in a new Java Element object. Also creates all its descendants, according to the structure schema.

Parameters:
doc - the document which will contain this element
elType - the element type of the element
label - a label string for this tree.
Returns:
the root Element for the new tree or null in case of failure
NewTree 
 public static Element NewTree(Document doc,
                               int type)
Create a new Element in the native Thot library and wrap it in a new Java Element object. Also creates all its descendants, according to the structure schema.

Parameters:
doc - the document which will contain this element
type - the type number of the element (w.r.t. the document SSchema)
label - a label string for this tree.
Returns:
the root Element for the new tree or null in case of failure
CreateDescent 
 public Element CreateDescent(ElementType elType)
Creates a new element of a given type and inserts it in the tree as a descendant of a given element. All elements of the descent required by the structure schema are also created.

Parameters:
elType - the element type of the child
Returns:
the Element for the new element or null in case of failure
CreateDescent 
 public Element CreateDescent(int type)
Creates a new element of a given type and inserts it in the tree as a descendant of a given element. All elements of the descent required by the structure schema are also created.

Parameters:
type - the type number of the child (w.r.t. the document SSchema)
Returns:
the Element for the new element or null in case of failure
CreateDescentWithContent 
 public Element CreateDescentWithContent(ElementType elType)
Creates a new element of a given type and inserts it in the tree as a descendant of a given element. All elements of the descent required by the structure schema are created, as well as the content of the requested element.

Parameters:
elType - the element type of the child
Returns:
the Element for the new element or null in case of failure
CreateDescentWithContent 
 public Element CreateDescentWithContent(int type)
Creates a new element of a given type and inserts it in the tree as a descendant of a given element. All elements of the descent required by the structure schema are created, as well as the content of the requested element.

Parameters:
type - the type number of the child (w.r.t. the document SSchema)
Returns:
the Element for the new element or null in case of failure
CopyTree 
 public Element CopyTree(Document dest,
                         Element parent)
Creates a copy of a tree.

Parameters:
dest - the receiving Document object.
parent - element that will become the parent of the created tree
Returns:
the Element root of the new tree, or null in case of failure
RemoveTree 
 public void RemoveTree()
Removes a tree (or a single element) from its tree, without freeing it

DeleteTree 
 public void DeleteTree()
Deletes a tree (or a single element) and frees it

 public Attribute GetAttribute(AttributeType atType)
Get the Attribute object of a given type of this Element.

Returns:
the document number for this element
Language 
 public char Language()
Get the language of an Element.

Returns:
the char naming the language (see w3c.thotlib.APILanguage)
TextContent 
 public StringBuffer TextContent()
return the StringBuffer associated to the text contained in this object or gathered from it's childs.

Returns:
a StringBuffer containing the value, NOTE : modifying this return value do not get reflect in the document. Returns null in case of failure.
SetTextContent 
 public void SetTextContent(String content)
Set the text contwent of an element. This element has to be of type text or be abble to receive a text value.

Parameters:
content - the actual string describing the new content of the element text.
Parent 
 public Element Parent()
Returns the parent of the current element, if available.

Returns:
the parent of the current element if available, null otherwise.
FirstChild 
 public Element FirstChild()
Returns the first child of the current element, if available.

Returns:
the first child of the current element if available, null otherwise.

 public Element LastChild()

Returns:
the last child of the current element if available, null otherwise.

 public Element Successor()

Returns:

Predecessor 
 public Element Predecessor()
Returns the predecessor of the current element, if available.

Returns:
the predecessor of the current element if available, null otherwise.
InsertSibling 
 public void InsertSibling(Element el,
                           boolean before)
Inserts a sibling of the current element.

Parameters:
el - the new sibling of the current element
before - boolean indicating if the new element should be inserted before or after the current element.
InsertChild 
 public void InsertChild(Element el,
                         boolean first)
Inserts a child to the current element.

Parameters:
el - the new child of the current element
first - boolean indicating if the new element should be inserted as the first child or the last child of the current element.
Select 
 public void Select()
set up the Thot selection to be this element.

AskUserClick 
 public static Element AskUserClick()

 public void Print()
debugging.
